remarks: doi:10.1600/036364420X15801369352360 The specific epithet colibri means hummingbird in Portuguese. Santa Teresa, where the type specimen was collected, is also known as terra doce dos colibris not only because these birds are indeed abundant there but also because Augusto Ruschi lived in Santa Teresa and studied the hummingbirds from there throughout his life.
